results.title: The possible role of medial prefrontal cortex beta-1-adrenoceptors in morphine-induced amnesia.
results.text_hl: Moreover, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-caused @<m>DISEASE_Amnesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000647 @@@amnesia@@@ was reversed by an ineffective dose of @CHEMICAL_Xamoterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017307 @@@xamoterol@@@ (0.1 microg/@SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@).

citations.NLM: Torkaman-Boutorabi A, Hashemi-Hezaveh SM, Sheidadoust H, Zarrindast MR. The possible role of medial prefrontal cortex beta-1-adrenoceptors in morphine-induced amnesia. Pharmacology. 2014;93(5-6):272-7. PMID: 25096537
citations.BibTeX: @article{25096537, title={The possible role of medial prefrontal cortex beta-1-adrenoceptors in morphine-induced amnesia.}, author={Torkaman-Boutorabi A and Hashemi-Hezaveh SM and Sheidadoust H and Zarrindast MR}, journal={Pharmacology}, volume={93}, number={5-6}, pages={272-7}}

results.title: The amnesic effect of intra-central amygdala administration of a cannabinoid CB1 receptor agonist, WIN55,212-2, is mediated by a beta-1 noradrenergic system in rat.
results.text_hl: Moreover, the improving effect of @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoprenaline@@@ (0.025 mug/@SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@) on @<m>DISEASE_Amnesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000647 @@@amnesia@@@ induced by @CHEMICAL_(3R)_((2_3_dihydro_5_methyl_3_((4_morpholinyl)methyl)pyrrolo_(1_2_3_de)_1_4_benzoxazin_6_yl)(1_naphthalenyl))methanone @CHEMICAL_MESH:C070417 @@@WIN55,212-2@@@ (0.25 mug/@SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@) was prevented by intra-CeA co-injections of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ at doses of 0.01 and 0.025 mug/@SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@.

citations.NLM: Zarrindast MR, Ghiasvand M, Rezayof A, Ahmadi S. The amnesic effect of intra-central amygdala administration of a cannabinoid CB1 receptor agonist, WIN55,212-2, is mediated by a beta-1 noradrenergic system in rat. Neuroscience. 2012 Jun 14;212():77-85. PMID: 22516010
citations.BibTeX: @article{22516010, title={The amnesic effect of intra-central amygdala administration of a cannabinoid CB1 receptor agonist, WIN55,212-2, is mediated by a beta-1 noradrenergic system in rat.}, author={Zarrindast MR and Ghiasvand M and Rezayof A and Ahmadi S}, journal={Neuroscience}, volume={212}, pages={77-85}}
